alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:59PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McCurtain, northern Franklin and Red River Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nashoba to near Roxton to near Greenville Club Lake. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Hagansport, Idabel, Broken Bow, Bogata, Bagwell, Manchester, Wright City, Valliant, Detroit, Deport, Millerton, Garvin, Rufe, Smithville, Hochatown, Watson, Battiest, Pickens and Mount Herman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
